meanings.definition: The dissolution or destruction of a cell by the disruption of its plasma membrane.
meanings.sent1: The cytolysis of the cell was caused by the membrane breaking apart.
meanings.sent2: Scientists observed cytolysis in the lab when the cell membrane disintegrated.
meanings.sent3: The cytolysis of the cell membrane was like a sudden explosion in a tiny world.
meanings.sent4: The cytolysis of the cell membrane was a silent but deadly process.
meanings.sent5: The cytolysis of the cell membrane left a trail of destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: The breaking down of cells by the action of enzymes.
meanings.sent1: Enzymes played a crucial role in the cytolysis of the cells.
meanings.sent2: The process of cytolysis sped up when enzymes were introduced.
meanings.sent3: The enzymes in the cytolysis party were the real MVPs.
meanings.sent4: The cytolysis process with enzymes was like a well-orchestrated symphony.
meanings.sent5: The cytolysis caused by enzymes was a biochemical masterpiece.
